conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a parallel-plate capacitor and a point charge at the midpoint.
Description of a parallel-plate capacitor with charges +Q and -Q and a uniform electric field.
Recalling the formula for electric field E = σ / ε₀.
Considering a simpler way to find the force without calculating the electric field from first principles.
Relating potential difference V to electric field E and capacitance C.
Deriving E = Q / (C * d) from V = Q / C and V = E * d.
Calculating force F = q * E = q * (Q / (C * d)).
Considering if the midpoint placement of the charge affects the force.
Concluding that the force is the same everywhere in a uniform field.
Reaffirming the force calculation F = q * (Q / (C * d)).

Rearranging terms using C = ε₀ * A / d.

Considering A = Q / σ and consistency.
